news.title: ‘It would create a highly undesirable precedent’ – JP Magnier’s plans to demolish farm buildings refused following appeal
news.summary: Plans by JP Magnier to demolish derelict farm buildings in Co Tipperary have been refused by An Coimisiún Pleanála following an appeal.

news.title: Conor McGregor has less than a month to respond to lawsuit alleging sex assault in US
news.summary: Former UFC champion Conor McGregor has less than a month to respond to a civil lawsuit claiming he allegedly sexually assaulted a woman in the US.

news.title: Jim Gavin will need civil servants to guide him on Áras role if he becomes president, says Leo Varadkar
news.summary: Jim Gavin will need help from civil servants on the political and legal aspects of the role if he becomes president, Leo Varadkar has said.

news.title: ‘Get used to higher food costs’ – inflation hitting consumers’ pockets with the price of butter alone up 50pc
news.summary: Consumers have been told to get used to higher food prices, with butter alone up 50pc in the last five years, the latest analysis shows.

news.title: ‘Did we get seduced into thinking we were better?’ – Leo Cullen wants Leinster to learn from ‘complacency’
news.summary: By the end of last season, Leo Cullen looked like he never wanted to see a microphone again but a summer off can work wonders and there was a boundless enthusiasm about the Leinster coach after he oversaw a high tempo training session at Greystones RFC yesterday.

news.title: ‘We decided to go for it on a night out at Christmas’ – three women on their first time competing at the National Ploughing Championships
news.summary: Throughout the National Ploughing Championships site, there are things far more industrial than agricultural.

news.title: The Irish Independent’s View: Israel is committing genocide in Gaza, but will the world do anything?
news.summary: One of the dismal lessons of the 20th century was that when dealing with death on an appalling scale, the world can come to accept it. However horrific the toll, it can still be assimilated in the commonplace.

news.title: ‘Everything is more stressful, more magnified, louder’ – the highs, lows and hurdles of raising kids when you have ADHD
news.summary: No one said having kids was easy – for every toothy grin and charming quirk, there’s a sleepless night, the chaos of the local playgroup and the insistence on reading  The Gruffalo  eight times over.

news.title: After a shock exit, Traitors suspects buckle amidst tears, treachery and naive trust
news.summary: Warning: Contains spoilers for ‘The Traitors Ireland’

news.title: Eoin McGee answers: ‘My 20-year-old son has €20k in savings. Should I encourage him to start a workplace pension ahead of auto-enrolment?’
